result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Filed by Atty. Kees requesting to have the 9/19/2022 Hearing canceled and the matter set for plea and sentencing in early December.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/14/22 - Request approved, to be rescheduled for P/S in December.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Atty Kees requesting an adjournment of the 7/18/22 hearing. **Reviewed by Judge Lau - due to no objection by the State the court will grant the adjournment.**
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.
dated 05-18-2022 from Atty. Anna Kees, requesting to adjourn the 05-23-2022 hearing out 60 days.  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/18/22 - Request granted.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Anna Kees
Hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:15 AM Defendant Garmani L Rhodes appeared by Zoom with attorney Anna M Kees who appeared by Zoom.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request to appear by zoom
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-30-2022. Granted
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Letter dated 03-15-2022 requesting adjournment filed by plaintiff.
  **Reviewed by Commissioner Kevin Costello on 03-15-2022. No Marsy's Law issues, time limits have been waived. Change matter to status on prelim, keeping the same date and time for scheduling and to have defense counsel appointed. Defendant to be present, in person.
Preliminary hearing on April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

02:38 PM Defendant Garmani L Rhodes in court, in custody, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.
Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
